summary: Internal FBI email chain discussing victim identification and notification procedures in the Jeffrey Epstein case ahead of an anticipated arrest. The emails focus on coordinating between FBI New York and SDNY to compile victim information, index it in the Victim Notification System (VNS), and ensure compliance with victim rights laws.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case being discussed; the emails are about identifying and notifying his victims ahead of his anticipated arrest.

events.title: FBI Coordination on Epstein Victim Notification
events.description: FBI personnel in New York discuss procedures for identifying and notifying victims of Jeffrey Epstein in anticipation of an upcoming arrest by SDNY.

events.title: Discussion of Upcoming Epstein Arrest
events.description: An FBI email states awareness of an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein, with SDNY planning a press release and an 800 number for victims to self-identify.

keyFacts: The FBI was aware of an upcoming arrest of Jeffrey Epstein as of June 25, 2019, and was preparing victim notification procedures.
At least two victims had been positively identified in the Victim Notification System (VNS), with many more identified by name only.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) planned to release a public 800 number for victims to self-identify following the arrest.
FBI personnel emphasized the urgency of indexing victim contact and guardian information to comply with federal victim notification laws.
The communication highlights internal FBI coordination between New York field offices and SDNY prosecutors on victim assistance ahead of a high-profile arrest.
